name: 14KT Gold Crane Ball and Hook Pendant
description:
This Pendant is based on the Ball and Hook assembly commonly found on Cranes. Also known as a Headache Ball. If you're an Ironworker or Crane Operator you would be at home with this. It is articulate and moves both at the top and from the hook. The ball is solid, not hollow.

This Crane Ball and Hook Pendant is cast in 14KT Yellow Gold and weighs approximately 14.7 grams. This listing if for the Pendant only and does not include the chain. A separate listing is available with the chain included. The Crane Ball and Hook Pendant is approximately 1 3/4" Long and the Ball is 1/2" in diameter. The master model is exclusive to WrenchHead Jewelry. 
Price $1329.00 CAD plus 5% GST within Canada. 
Available in Sterling Silver, 14KT, 18KT or Platinum. Quotes upon request. 

This Item is IN STOCK in 14KT Yellow Gold at the present time.

It can also be ordered in White Gold. 18KT or Platinum is also an option

Price does not include the chain.
Chain is available separately.

$60.00 CAD Shipping by FedEx to anywhere in the U.S. and Canada.
No mass production methods are used in the manufacture of my items. If this item is not presently in stock, it may take up to 14 days to create.

This Pendant, along with my other Jewelry are not mass produced, but conceived, Produced, Hand assembled and finished by me alone. name: 14KT Gold Pre Columbian Golden Airplane Replica Pendant
description:
ANCIENT INCAN AIRCRAFT ? 
  This Meticulously detailed and hand fabricated 14KT Yellow Gold Pendant is a scale replica of a Pre-Columbian artifact on display at the Museo Del Oro in Bogota, Colombia. 
This is a substantial Pendant that was hand carved and finished by Robert West to original dimensions. It is a fascinating piece of Jewelry.
It measures 33.73 mm in length and 24.35 mm in width across the wings. Bearing uncanny resemblance to modern aircraft, these oddly-shaped objects have been found in ancient tombs across central America. Fashioned in solid gold by the Chibchas, a pre-Incan culture, they were used as amulets, to decorate sacred trees and placed as offerings in tombs. Estimated at roughly 2000 years old, researchers have found 33 of them in Colombia, Peru, Costa Rica and Venezuela.
Although Archaeologists consider them stylistic renditions of birds or flying fish, from a modern standpoint they appear to be accurate three dimensional representations of very advanced aircraft, including an odd symbol on the wings like military aircraft of today.
In 1954, the original “Golden Airplane” was part of the Pre-Columbian Gold Exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York. The deltoid wing and vertical tail section immediately attracted the attention of aircraft designers. Newspapers of the day report that exhibition directors allowed it to be tested in a wind tunnel where it demonstrated remarkable maneuverability and the capability for supersonic speed. Some historians actually believe the Ancient model helped Lockheed technicians design their first supersonic plane. 
The "Aircraft" is listed as one of the Ten Most Mysterious Artifacts of the Ancient World and is presently used as the logo for the Ancient Astronaut Society. 
This is an extremely intriguing piece of jewelry that won't be found in retail stores. Order yours today and own a beautiful replica of this curious item.

Permission to use written intellectual property gratefully granted by:
Paul White of ANCIENT IMPRESSIONS    http://www.mondovista.com/impressions

                    Price below does not include the chain. 
                            Chain is available separately.

   No mass production methods are used in the manufacture of my items. If this item is not presently in stock, it may take up to 14 days to create.     

            Price $1073.00 CAD    plus 5% GST within Canada

This item is also available in 18KTY or 24KTY (999.9 pure)
    
$60.00 CAD Overnight Shipping by FedEx to anywhere in the U.S. and Canada.

name: Sterling Silver Olmec Mask Pendant c/w Chain
description:
This is my reproduction Olmec Mask made in Argentium Sterling Silver. It measures 1 1/8” wide X 1 1/8” long and is a Hand Carved and finished piece. An Italian 22” medium curb link chain with an updated Lobster clasp is included in the purchase price, although, it my opinion it would also look great with a black cord. 

The Olmec were the first major Pre-Columbian civilization in Mexico. They lived in the tropical lowlands of south-central Mexico, in the modern-day states of Veracruz and Tabasco. The Olmec flourished during Mesoamerica's Formative period, dating roughly from as early as 1500 BC to about 400 BC. Pre-Olmec cultures had flourished in the area since about 2500 BC, but by 1600-1500 BC Early Olmec culture had emerged centered around the San Lorenzo Tenochtitlán site near the coast in southeast Veracruz.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olmec

Price Includes a 22" Italian Made Sterling Silver medium Curb link Chain with a upgraded Lobster Clasp.

   No mass production methods are used in the manufacture of my items. If this item is not presently in stock, it may take up to 14 days to create.     
                                                                              
              Price $369.00 CAD     plus 5% GST within Canada 
 
Sterling Olmec Mask Pendant price includes Free Shipping by Post to Canada and the U.S.
